notesStmt.note: An image of the verso of the leaf is not currently available. On the verso is Hannah (Whitman) Heyde's November 10, 1868 letter to Louisa Van Velsor Whitman.

revisionDesc.change: updated project note about missing image of verso of leaf
moved notes to external file and added ptrs; checked
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
checked metadata and encoding and revised as necessary
Replaced smart quotes with straight; removed external URL links.
Changed straight quotes to character reference smart quotes.
Proofreading corrections in Ransom Center and dating
Transcribe 1 Page, regularize spelling, annotate Dr. Thayer

body.p:
i dont don't want to worry you but i thought i would send you hanna shanna's letter it is rather a strangely connected letter
but god only knows what will be the end of her troubles i have got one from him one of his ranting ones i cant can't tell what an awful letter it is) i wish she could be got here if matty and jeff does go back she could take that room till spring) The erysipluserysipelas generally affects the head so i think probably she will be quite smart) as she gets strenghtstrength doo do you think she gets your letters walter perhaps she does i was thinking maybee maybe it would be as well to send her one to the care of Dr. Thayer as i suppose he has a box at the post office but doo do as you think best walter dear) i am pretty well matty is about as usual Jeffy will come in a few weeks

dont don'tbe worried no more than you can help walter i know the nature of the disease george would get something in his head and worry as she does about the letter if heyd was kind to her she would get well
i wish you had went there walter when you was home
